This fast-paced role will have you working directly with employees across the company in a multi-faceted and well-respected position. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>scheduling, calendar management, and travel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing time registration and expenses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing team support for meetings, representation, information gathering, and deck creation, when requested<\u002Fli>\n  <li> lead some data consolidation tasks, including use of the Office suite of products, with creation and editing of documents, some internet searches and quantification of data outputs <\u002Fli>\n  <li>providing onsite administrative support in our Boston office for events and meetings<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing onsite administrative support in other Ørsted offices for events and meetings, when requested. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>thrive in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to look and plan ahead<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintain a calm disposition regardless of the situation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are detail-oriented and thorough with completing your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with tact.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where you’ll develop offshore wind and achieve productive coexistence with a wide spectrum of current ocean users and maritime stakeholders <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll serve as a public outreach representative to maritime stakeholders, incl. the fishing industry, where you’ll facilitate communication between those stakeholders and Marine Affairs. You’ll also manage the Marine Affairs team’s communications outreach, incl. writing and publishing mariners briefings and drafting various notices and information for posting on our web site and social, electronic, and traditional platforms. You’ll also communicate to Ørsted’s internal stakeholders about Marine Affairs tasks and equities.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Permitting, Environment, and Marine Affairs<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Marine Affairs team where you, together with your colleagues, will perform as a diverse team of navigation experts and marine scientists located throughout the North-eastern US. In collaboration with your colleagues, you’ll focus intently on engaging, leading, and managing maritime stakeholders, especially in the southern New England region. Your home office will be Providence, RI. As a team, we envision a world that runs entirely on green energy. This ambitious goal relies on maximizing the talents of a truly inclusive workforce that brings diversity of thought, perspective, and knowledge. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>communicating regularly and effectively with stakeholders, ensuring timely information dissemination through multiple platforms about offshore project activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> keeping the organization aware of any immediate problems or concerns from maritime stakeholders, particularly fisheries stakeholders both recreational and commercial<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with the internal Americas management, and other stakeholder liaisons and Fisheries Representatives to develop a strategic plan for engaging and managing maritime stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating Marine Affairs’ plans and activities to Fisheries Representatives and to the recreational fishing, commercial fishing, and other maritime industries<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working to mitigate potential adverse project impacts by ensuring timely dissemination of information regarding project activities, incl. planned vessel movements or delays<\u002Fli>\n  <li> engaging maritime stakeholders through outreach meetings, conferences, on-site visits, and one-on-one interactions to gather views and facilitate communication and information sharing.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a background in mass communications, stakeholder engagement, public relations, or related disciplines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have demonstrated maritime knowledge and experience in any of the following: fisheries, marine operations, marine construction, or other maritime-related disciplines with a preference for knowledge with the US East Coast fishing industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are thoroughly familiar with web design and publishing, and posting on other social platforms such as Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent written communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are a trustworthy and impactful communicator and are comfortable addressing large groups both in person and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a proactive and systematic approach to your work tasks and are familiar with the Microsoft Office suite.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than February 1, 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, , on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do extensive travelling in relation to your work. Most travel will be within southern New England (Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York) but will include occasional trips elsewhere in the US and perhaps Europe. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> February 1, 2023, 23:59 EST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Providence <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Talent Acquisition Operations US <\u002Fp>\n   <p>the Operations team <\u002Fp>\n   <p>talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 8.000 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, We’re committed to secure an inclusive work environment characterized by a respect for all people so everyone feels free to openly share their input and ideas. You’ll be responsible for sourcing, validating, and integrating technology solutions from external innovation ecosystems across the globe.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Innovation<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Ventures &amp; Open Innovation where you, together with your colleagues, will follow an impactful and broad agenda focused on strategic innovation and business development. You’ll join a dynamic, international, and collaborative team, working across locations around the world. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>meeting with internal stakeholders across the Onshore business to identify and prioritize challenges and opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analyzing and maturing potential solutions that address identified Onshore challenges and opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing and executing projects in collaboration with Onshore business units to test, scale, and integrate solutions into the business that prove value<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting your colleagues with investment opportunities by helping with technical due diligence and bringing relevant opportunities forward for discussion.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a technical degree or demonstrated technical background - in areas of onshore green energy is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have demonstrated experience with commercializing technology in a corporation, whether in an engineering or innovation role<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are comfortable in an international organization and can quickly create strong relationships with your colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a solid understanding of and ability to communicate on a broad range of topics related to onshore green energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong organizational and project management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have start-up experience, whether as a part of a start-up or a start-up support organization, will be helpful.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than January 31, 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Specialist, if you’d like to know more about the position. <p>Imagine a future where you shape America’s transition to clean energy at one of the world’s largest renewable energy companies <\u002Fp>\n <p>company’s overall US offshore wind labor relations policies. Together with the Head of US Labor Relations, project teams, and the state market managers, you’ll help implement labor strategies to ensure the successful advancement of existing projects, inform efforts to secure additional business, enhance economic and employment opportunities in partnership with community stakeholders, and shape our position and reputation as market leader in the region. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Labor Relations <\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Labor Relations where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for shaping and implementing the company’s labor relations policies, maintaining constructive relationships with stakeholders to positively impact the emerging US offshore wind market. As part of our team, you’ll be part of a collaborative culture characterized by trust, respect, openness, and strong commitment to equity and justice.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting the work of the Head of Labor Relations and operational leadership on union-related issues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting implementation of the company’s labor relations strategy, policies, procedures, and action plans to achieve overall organizational objectives relative to labor-management partnerships<\u002Fli>\n  <li> disseminating our labor policies within internal business areas and with outside vendors and ensuring that such policies are adhered to in all procurement, construction, and operational activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting the Labor Relations team in maintaining constructive relationships with applicable union representatives at the state level<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring states in which we are active and strategically responding to risks to ensure that our projects are aligned with local community interests<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining current knowledge of employee and labor relations trends.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold a bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline, e.g., industrial and labor relations, social science, labor economics, employment or labor law, or workforce development <\u002Fli>\n  <li>OR have 5-7 years of relevant professional experience related to labor unions, community organizing, inequity and equity issues, and climate change<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate firm understanding of legal contract language and have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written <\u002Fli>\n  <li>possess deep familiarity with principles of organizing, collective bargaining, and strategic campaigns to contribute to the development of projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can find creative solutions to issues and work with a diverse set of internal and external stakeholders and travel frequently throughout the Northeast region in relation to your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> if you feel like you don’t meet all the requirements for this role, we encourage you to apply anyways – talent is diverse by nature. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-30. onshore wind projects in North America. You’ll perform strategic sourcing tender processes which will deliver positive commercial results while managing risks for our business.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to NA Procurement<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of a growing and ambitious team characterised by a commercial and curious mindset where you, together with your bright colleagues, will be responsible for defining sourcing strategies and providing input to the strategic development of the indirect categories. You’ll also lead our sourcing and tender projects in close cooperation with the business stakeholders and the global Services Procurement team. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being commercially responsible for sourcing goods and services, mainly within the facility management, professional services, IT, and HR services categories<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading and delivering the entire strategic sourcing process from start to finish, i.e., market analysis, tender process, contract negotiations, stakeholder management, and contract management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> building relationships with important stakeholders within the organization to support the realization and optimization of commercial value and risk management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> having significant influence on the prioritization and implementation of initiatives for the strategic development within these areas<\u002Fli>\n  <li> proactively suggesting improvements to processes, procedures, workflows, and organizational structures related to strategic sourcing.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a cross-disciplinary background based on a master’s degree in economics, supply chain, law, or engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a broad and deep knowledge of the strategic sourcing process and a well-developed sourcing ‘toolbox’<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an experienced negotiator, taking responsibility for planning and executing the negotiation process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have extensive experience with procurement tools and processes in large organizations <\u002Fli>\n  <li>have experience with contract law, i.e., contract advisory, such as securing contract compliance within the organization and value creation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than January 30, 2023. <p>Imagine a future where you lead a team and oversee the standardization and implementation of contracts across onshore procurement<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for developing and executing the contract strategy by working together with external stakeholders to negotiate contractual agreements and communicate to internal stakeholders as it relates to commercial risk.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Procurement and Construction<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our Procurement team where you, together with your colleagues, will ensure that processes and contractual agreements are communicated and implemented by the onshore procurement team, while managing external stakeholders. As a team, we value diversity and support the growth our team by offering learning and development opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>being the responsible party for standardization of contract processes and implementation of procurement agreements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working with external stakeholders to negotiate and come to contractual agreements and internal stakeholders as it relates to commercial risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing and managing drafting, evaluating, negotiating, and executing contracts in compliance with our legal and commercial objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing standardize and implement master services or supply agreements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> acting as the subject matter expert on all contract related needs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing a team which include their workload, priorities, resource allocation, and professional growth of direct reports.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have 8+ years of experience in renewable energy with procurement or supply chain management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have expert level experience in standardization of contract processes and implementation of procurement agreements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in managing teams, conducting performance reviews, and giving constructive feedback<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess expert level experience negotiating, executing, and managing contracts with experience in the renewable sector<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a bachelor’s degree in relevant field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication skills and ability to influence stakeholders. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where you’re a key part of ensuring environmental regulatory compliance for our proposed offshore wind projects on the East Coast of the US <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for leading the implementation of the Environmental Permit Compliance program for the construction, operation, and decommissioning of the Ocean Wind 01 offshore wind farm. You’ll work with colleagues in the United States and Europe, specialist consultants, and in consultation with regulatory authorities and stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to US Permitting<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our North American Permitting, Environment, and Marine Affairs (PEMA) team where you, together with your colleagues, will support, develop, and lead the implementation of the Environmental Permit Compliance program for Ocean Wind 01, in coordination with your permitting colleagues, compliance colleagues, and the other departments such as QHSE, Construction managers, EPC package managers, our Operations team, and our Joint Venture partner. As a team, we empower individuals, collaborate, share knowledge, and share successes, so as to resolve the challenges associated with delivering the first commercial scale offshore wind projects in the US.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>planning and coordinating the efficient environmental and regulatory reviews and permitting of projects, incl. preparing applications to regulatory entities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the success of the Compliance Management System (CMS) and associated activity-specific compliance tools, through the continued development, implementation, and optimization of these tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working as a liaison with our QHSE and EPC teams to support Ørsted’s compliance audit program<\u002Fli>\n  <li> tracking permit conditions as project approvals are obtained, assisting construction managers, site managers, and contractor crews in the implementation of conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading and training environmental compliance contractors and consultants, environmental inspectors, third-party environmental monitors, and associated compliance field personnel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring fulfilment of compliance obligations for monitoring, recordkeeping, and reporting to local, state, and federal agencies.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold, as a minimum, a bachelor’s degree within a relevant field, e.g., permitting, environmental policy, construction management, marine affairs, or other disciplines related to development and construction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have min. five years’ related professional experience, e.g., from large-scale infrastructure projects, energy projects, environmental permit management, environment compliance management, or through working for development\u002F environmental consultancies, Federal or State agencies, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are experienced with interpreting and applying local, state, and federal environmental regulations and developing\u002Fmaintaining relationships with key regulators; familiarity with BOEM, USACE, EPA, and state and federal protected species regulations is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience collaborating and communicating effectively with interdisciplinary teams, such as QHSE, construction, EPC, and project management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can adapt to changing conditions and work well in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment within tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent technical writing skills and stakeholder management abilities and are a trustworthy and impactful communicator.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than February 7, 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, , on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do regular traveling in relation to your work, as you’ll need to be able to travel occasionally to New Jersey job sites to meet with construction staff, contractors, and regulators (typically one to three days per trip) and may require periodic boat-based trips to the offshore site.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 8.000 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Imagine a future where you chart a successful course for our quickly growing green hydrogen and e-fuels business in the Americas <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll identify and originate business opportunities for large-scale electrolysis and e-fuels production projects in the US. You’ll develop commercial concepts and engage customers and partners directly to substantiate opportunities. Moreover, your commercial experience and customer relationships will help inform and steer our commercial strategy.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Power-to-X Americas<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of P2X Americas where you, together with your colleagues, will develop and deliver projects producing fuels via renewable electricity, selling them into existing and new markets. We’re planning for rapid growth due to supportive federal policy and a strong Ørsted renewable generation footprint, and you’ll be responsible for a key part of that growth. As a team, we work closely and collaboratively with a heavy emphasis on ideas, initiative, and learning, in the early stage of this nascent industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>originating new business relationships and project concepts that demonstrate commercial and strategic value to the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining and growing a network of customer and partner contacts to support existing and new P2X projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> collaborating closely with colleagues in Ørsted’s renewables business to ensure a path to renewable power feedstock for new opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> drafting and presenting materials on project opportunities to P2X Americas leadership through approval stage gates.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have 5+ years of business development or commercial experience in gas and liquids or renewable energy industries, with experience in hydrogen, ammonia, and\u002For methanol being considered a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an existing professional network in one or more offtake sectors for hydrogen or e-fuels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate tenacity, drive, and creativity when approaching new and unique challenges<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent communication skills and the ability to influence internal or external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-20. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we’re happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do some traveling in relation to your work, as you’ll be meeting with customers and partners, attending conferences and industry events, and joining internal meetings at other Ørsted offices. <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>monitoring and assessing that project specific KPIs for QHSE are below target<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating actively in the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the assigned QHSE advisors and coordinating other QHSE support for the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating with the wider business to implement our QHSE requirements to ensure consistency and efficiency between projects, and compliance with Ørsted corporate management systems and processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being the focal point of contact for local authorities and other key stakeholders in relation to QHSE on the projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a minimum of five years’ experience in QHSE and have a degree or similar within QHSE, or a technical or engineering discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have certificates or licenses from any QHSE-recognized institutes e.g., IOSH, ASP\u002FCSP, CQI, or PMP<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have industry recognised QHSE qualifications, e.g., NEBOSH or Six Sigma<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have proven experience in the field of QHSE from relevant fields of industry, i.e. the construction, infrastructure, offshore, or energy industries<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong management skills and experienced in working across multiple projects and implementing corporate systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent stakeholder management skills, working with multiple stakeholders both internally and externally and excellent communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n <p>Imagine a future where you ensure excellent financial reporting by leveraging your analytical skills and accounting knowledge <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for a broad set of financial accounting and reporting processes concerning the Ørsted Group’s legal entities in North America. You’ll be involved in month-end close processes, account reconciliations, and the preparation of financial statements.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling (‘FAC’)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our global Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for the financial reporting and delivering standardized, high-quality, and timely accounting and reporting products. Working from our Chicago office, you’ll be part of a fast-growing local team that supports Ørsted’s Americas business. As a team, we’re united in supporting each other’s development and delivering on outcomes with integrity and by valuing teamwork.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>maintaining the general ledger and preparing financial journals, such as payroll and fixed assets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> performing periodic reconciliations for your entities’ balance sheet accounts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing statutory financial statements in accordance with US GAAP accounting standards and providing supporting audit documentation as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> reporting on several legal entities for month-end close reporting purposes through our group consolidation system<\u002Fli>\n  <li> delivering on other local reporting requirements, e.g., tax reporting and industry surveys<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimisation of processes – specifically in connection with month-end closing and our reporting systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s degree in accounting, controlling, or similar and a CPA certification is strongly preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have relevant experience working in a public accounting firm or a dynamic finance department, preferably in an international company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> speak and write English at an advanced level, and can communicate clearly in writing, and excel at communicating financial issues in a readily understandable manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have an analytical and logical approach to issues as well as the ability to critically handle information you receive<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are result-oriented and set visible and relevant goals for your tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a fast-changing environment, take independent responsibility, and enjoy working with colleagues across teams and national borders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than February 28, 2023. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact , , on if you’d like to know more about the position. <p>Imagine a future where you lead the buildout of renewable generation to support our growing Power-to-X business<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll supervise projects from site identification through the start of construction along with strategic planning towards future growth supporting the P2X market. The role will focus on North America, with strong experience needed in ERCOT. Your initial responsibility will involve delivering the ~1.2-1.5GW of wind and solar assets needed to support our flagship P2X project in Texas. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Welcome to Ørsted Onshore North America<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of P2X Development where you, together with your colleagues, will manage the development budgets for P2X build out and support the Vice President. You’ll also lead a cross-functional team of subject matter experts in the assessment of potential development prospects and maturation of existing development assets, incl. both greenfield and acquisition.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>coordinating between the Onshore team and P2X, Technical, Finance, and Legal teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying and resolving potential project flaws and prioritizing critical path to prepare projects for FNTP on schedule and on budget<\u002Fli>\n  <li> showing accountability for constructing and presenting development plans and long and short-term project schedules for the execution of pipeline supporting the P2X business to senior management and ExCom teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> developing monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasting activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing land banks and securing permitting, interconnection, tax incentives, and regulatory approvals<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing and managing relationships with stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>can effectively demonstrate your experience in managing teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate strong organizational, networking, leadership, and time management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess excellent communication skills and the ability to influence<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a minimum of 7 years' experience in developing large scale wind projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate proven success working with government affairs, legal trade associations, and joint venture agreements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing, green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-30. where you’ll be overall responsible for FM resources and facilities in the region with regards to FM management service delivery, cleaning and waste service delivery, security services delivery, property services delivery, facility support, and QHSE and compliance, etc. You’ll be the key point of contact for senior stakeholders in the region, responsible for people and talent development with As a team, we work in trust-based work environment, seek learning opportunities, and collaborate though knowledge sharing and teamwork. We constantly strive for improvements, both individually and as a team.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>bridging the regional facility management deliveries towards, and supporting, the global and regional overarching business goals and objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the regional FM strategy supporting the global GREWM strategy by ensuring optimization of all cultural aspects, developing regional guidelines, standards, and oversights<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing input to the development of global and regional best practices for local adaptation and innovating and driving continuous development for short and long-term value adding<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working within, and taking ownership of, governance for FM providers and partners <\u002Fli>\n  <li>managing procurement projects and engaging service partners in alignment with the Global FM function<\u002Fli>\n  <li> acting as a go-to person in all tactical FM and workplace matters.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>hold an MSc. in engineering, economics, or similar, have experience with HSE-related issues around FM and authorities, and LCA\u002Flifecycle thinking experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate a clear moral compass and never compromise on doing what is right<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the bandwidth, knowledge, and analytical skills to grasp structure, solve FM business challenges, engage others, set clear agendas, and lead across distances<\u002Fli>\n  <li> take ownership, stay on energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. <p>Imagine a future where you develop green hydrogen and renewable fuels from project concept through the start of construction in the US<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll establish and coordinate the project team to deliver on the business objectives of your green fuel projects, incl. schedule, budget, scope, quality, and safety.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to P2X Americas<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of P2X Americas where you, together with your colleagues, will deliver world- class projects on green fuels and green molecules to major international customers through careful development, execution, and operation. These projects work with the foremost experts in process engineering, permitting, procurement, construction, and operations, with both internal and external stakeholders. As a team, we collaborate across international borders, embrace learning new technology and opportunities and sharing knowledge, and provide support to one another to succeed in our projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>maturing projects to FNTP, incl. identifying and resolving project flaws, site selection, and securing permitting, regulatory approvals, feedstock, and interconnection<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing and coordinating a project team, incl. internal and external Technical, Finance, Renewables Development, and Legal teams, as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the management of project risks and HSE <\u002Fli>\n  <li>drafting, communicating, and delivering on development plans and project schedules and budgets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing regular status updates and decision proposals for project stage gates to the P2X leadership team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have 5+ years of project development experience in gas and liquids or renewable energy industries, with hydrogen, ammonia, and\u002For methanol experience being a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate tenacity, drive, and creativity when approaching new and unique development challenges<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong working knowledge of technical disciplines sufficient to coordinate the necessary internal and external subject matter experts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong organizational, networking, leadership, and time management skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-20. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do some traveling in relation to your work, as you’ll be meeting with subject matter experts, vendors, team members, and project sites associated with the projects. The majority of travel will be in the USA with a concentration of travel to projects in the Texas Gulf Coast region and offices in Austin and Houston.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your <p>Imagine a future where you’re part of the Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling team, ensuring excellent financial reporting by leveraging business knowledge <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for a broad set of financial accounting and reporting processes concerning the Group’s legal entities. You’ll be involved in the preparation of financial statements and deal with external stakeholders. Drawing from your analytical skills you’ll help with assessing interesting transactions for appropriate accounting treatment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling (FAC)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of our global Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for the controlling of financial reporting and delivering standardized, high-quality, and timely accounting and reporting products. Working from our Chicago office, you’ll be part of a fast-growing local team that supports the onshore wind division in North America. The FAC team is united in supporting each other’s development and delivering on outcomes with integrity and by valuing teamwork.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>contributing to technical accounting research and policy-setting, incl. implementing and monitoring compliance with relevant accounting standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> the financial controlling and reporting of several of our North American corporate, project and joint venture entities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> contributing to periodic US GAAP reporting for internal and external users and interface with external auditors regarding statutory financial statements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring and managing our US intercompany reconciliations and cost allocation models and collaborating with tax colleagues in preparing and maintaining book-to-tax schedules and documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimization of processes, specifically in connection with month-end closing and our reporting systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assisting in accounting for non-routine transactions, such as acquisitions, divestitures, and debt transactions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a CPA licence or equivalent professional qualification, and have experience working in accounting pronouncements, e.g., revenue recognition, business combinations and leases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a fast-changing environment, take independent responsibility, and enjoy working with <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for providing technical support associated with the development, engineering, and execution of the landfall installation to facilitate the pull-in of HV export cables connecting our offshore wind farms. You’ll be interacting directly with the contractors, consultants, and a vast suite of internal stakeholders to manage the scope and relevant interfaces.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Welcome to Export Cable Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Export Cable Management where you, together with your colleagues, will be ensuring the highest quality of the design, engineering, procurement of services, and execution of the landfall scope in challenging projects and markets. Together, you’ll ensure alignment with Permitting, Site Investigation, and Risk Management. As a team, we are open-minded, share our ideas and lessons learned, and work closely together across countries. We embrace diversity and support development.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing the design and engineering of all aspects of the landfall, ensuring that it’s in line with international standards and contractual requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing technical expertise to support the project manager in decision-making and its substantiation throughout the lifecycle, leading the interface with other work scopes, both onshore and offshore<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing documentation for permitting with the technical solution, ensuring that the method and design for the landfall scope are both viable and comply with the legal commitments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading the technical aspect of the procurement process, ensuring contractor engagement, and considering safety, quality, budget, and schedule, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have demonstrable experience within engineering or delivery of onshore and offshore landfall installations and are familiar with the principles of trenchless technology, incl. HDD for long length, large-diameter, and complex installations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have in-depth knowledge of civils design and operation, incl. direct excavation of trenches within the onshore or offshore environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can work on numerous tasks, challenges, and projects simultaneously and independently, and drive collaboration and coordination between various stakeholders to ensure the optimum solution, recognising the constraints on both the landfall scope and those affecting our interface parties<\u002Fli>\n  <li> take responsibility for all technical aspects relating to landfall design, engineering, procurement, and construction, to ensure an effective installation of high-voltage export cables.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> february 15 2023, 23:59 EDT <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Boston, Newark <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> 40 <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Jodi Smith <\u002Fp>\n   <p>Senior Talent Acquisition Partner <\u002Fp>\n   <p>(United States +1) 6035141700<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p>Join a global leader in renewable energy<br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where you lead the development of a portfolio of projects, contributing to building a world that runs entirely on renewable energy <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll work closely with the Senior Development Director and lead the development of a portfolio of commercial-scale solar, wind, and energy storage projects from initial project definition to final investment decision. Your previous development experience will give you the professional autonomy to further the development of various renewable energy projects. You’ll oversee the project stakeholders, managing a group of land agents and steering the project team consisting of permitting, interconnection, engineering, real estate, resource assessment, and construction experts.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Ørsted Onshore Development<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the East U.S. Development team where you, together with your colleagues, will identify and develop high-quality wind, solar, and battery projects across the East United-States, i.e., ERCOT, MISO, NYISO, NEISO, SERC. From time to time, you’ll also be tasked with mentoring project analysts and junior developers. You’ll work closely with the East United States Senior Development Director and Directors to build the portfolio and bring it to maturity. As a team, we develop a culture of excellence by learning from each other’s strengths and experience, improving our practices and creating a safe environment where every team member can thrive.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>independently leading the development of a large-scale portfolio of renewable energy projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> identifying development prospects, incl. market assessments, initial site reconnaissance, and fatal flaw identification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing and managing relationships with stakeholders, incl. elected officials, regulators, utilities, RTOs, and community leaders, to support project development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating, managing, controlling, and evaluating development projects, schedules, and budgets, from site identification to COD<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating with internal resources, e.g., the Legal, Engineering, Construction, Finance, and Energy Assessment teams, to drive projects forward<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting a development review of project contracts, incl. real estate, tax abatement, EPC\u002FBOP, PPA, GIA, and other binding agreements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>possess strong communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a BA, B.Sc., or MBA from an accredited college<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a fundamental understanding of the renewable energy project development life cycle, incl. real estate, permitting, interconnection, and project marketing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong business acumen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with the planning and siting of renewable energy projects, with the ability to use GIS software tools being an asset<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have professional experience with project identification, green fielding, and strategy implementation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-02-28. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. leaders to successfully implement and anchor standard operational processes. As a team, we nurture a culture where we deliver honest and caring feedback to each other and our stakeholders. We’re curious to understand the context of where we operate and the people we engage.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>supporting coaching, and mentoring<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting, coaching, and advising initiatives on how to successfully manage the people side of change to enhance the benefits and adoption rates of the new ways of working<\u002Fli>\n  <li> working closely with regional process drivers and leaders to define, execute, adjust, and monitor the regional implementation plan for global standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting regional leadership teams in setting targets and deploying the strategy.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n interfacing with external auditors of US GAAP financial statements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring and managing our US intercompany reconciliations and cost allocation models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimization of processes – specifically in connection with month-end closing and our reporting systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> holding responsibility for communication with joint venture partners regarding accounting matters.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a CPA license, or equivalent professional qualification and experience working in either a public accounting firm or an accounting department in an international company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have thorough knowledge of US GAAP, with IFRS experience being a bonus, both from a theoretical and practical point of view<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with implementing new accounting pronouncements, e.g., revenue recognition, business combinations, and leases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> take a methodical approach to your work and excel at communicating financial accounting concepts in a readily understandable manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can balance multiple priorities and drive timely outcomes in a fast-changing environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can coach and lead other team members through effectively sharing your knowledge and experience.<\u002Fli>\n <p>Imagine a future where you can channel your passion for renewable energy to help us analyze, design, and improve the next generation of renewable projects <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll have the opportunity to work across the Onshore pipeline, contributing your experience and expertise to analyze and optimize a wide range of solar and wind projects. This is also an excellent opportunity for you to improve existing processes and conduct ongoing R&amp;D to support better understanding of our operational projects and how that impacts the pre-construction assessment process.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Onshore Tech &amp; Ops<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of the Energy Analysis team where you, together with your colleagues, will work closely to conduct solar and wind site data analysis, project modeling, and energy yield assessments to support the design of our onshore utility scale solar and wind projects. The Energy Analysis team supports all stages of project development, construction, and operation, as well as across disciplines, to provide technically accurate and informative assessments. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>assessing turbine performance and the impact of environmental constraints<\u002Fli>\n  <li> effectively managing teamwork and projects to deliver projects on time and within budget<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating complex technical issues to a non-technical audience, both verbally and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> optimizing solar and wind projects as well as modeling the wind flow over project sites<\u002Fli>\n  <li> analyzing and interpreting measured solar data, wind data, and operational project data.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a BS in Engineering, Atmospheric Science, or another relevant technical field of study<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have demonstrable experience in solar resource analysis (energy yield assessment)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong communication and analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> know how to effectively prioritize tasks and communicate with project stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. To be a frontrunner, we invest significantly in employee development, and from the moment you join us, we’ll support your personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll get the opportunities that will unleash your full potential, and you’ll experience a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic work environment. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than February 15, 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We offer a flexible workplace, and in this position, you’ll be working in a hybrid (office and home-working) set-up. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> February 15, 2023, 23:59 EST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Chicago, Austin, Charlottesville <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Talent Acquisition Operations US <\u002Fp>\n   <p>the Operations team <\u002Fp>\n   <p>talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> 6,800 employees worldwide.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Headquartered in Denmark and located in 13 countries.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ørsted develops, constructs and operates offshore and onshore wind farms, solar farms, energy storage facilities, and bioenergy plants, and provides energy products to its customers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><br> <br> <b>An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation or beliefs. <p>Imagine a future where you lead the development of complex Power-to-X projects whose construction aims to decarbonize hard-to-abate sectors <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll lead the development of projects involving the installation of water electrolysis and further downstream P2X processes for e-fuels. You’ll be involved in an increasing number of P2X projects across our portfolio, beginning with our Flagship US project which will be built in the Gulf Coast region and is currently in the early development phase.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Power to X (P2X)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of a growing and innovative P2X team of eight where you, together with your colleagues, will share the common objective of value creation. We offer a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic and lean team backed up by a large organization. You’ll be involved from the early stages of project development, through concept and site selection, permitting, engineering, tendering, and maturing a project to Final Investment Decision (FID). As a team, we work together to meet common objectives, share learnings, embrace new opportunities, and drive the business forward. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing P2X projects successfully through project gates<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for the overall project, incl. development, QHSE, time, scope, and budgets, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading and inspiring the project team to perform, in line with the project objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders, incl. project teams, steering committee, other decision-makers, and resource providers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the project in its development stage and presenting to the approval committee at FID and continuing to support it through construction and commissioning until Commercial Operations Date (COD)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> leading the projects with a hands-on approach by staying on top of the various aspects and aligning with the broader organizational objectives.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have at least ten years’ worth of project development experience in gas and liquids or renewable energy industries, with hydrogen, ammonia, and\u002For methanol experience considered a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have successfully completed a degree in engineering, business, or another relevant education<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are an experienced project manager with extensive hands-on work experience from complex high-value projects (USD 250m+), both in the development and project execution phases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a strong working knowledge of technical disciplines sufficient to coordinate the necessary internal and external subject matter experts and have strong organizational, networking, leadership, and time management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate tenacity, drive, and creativity when approaching new and unique development challenges and are a solutions-oriented thinker<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have full professional proficiency in spoken and written English. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-23. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process, we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do regular traveling in relation to your work, as you’ll make frequent trips to the project site to meet project stakeholders, consultants, customers, and others who are involved in the project.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application <p>Imagine a future where you digitize and automate onshore’s solar, wind, and battery performance monitoring in the world’s most sustainable energy company<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll get the opportunity to architect, build, and govern solutions that provide the foundation for a cloud-based analytics platform for our onshore business unit, tapping into the enterprise solution.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Asset Performance<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Data Science team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for creation, deployment, and withing the team.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>designing and building efficient data pipelines (ETLs) for modern cloud-based analytics from a variety of sources using industry best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> maintaining the existing production pipelines and troubleshooting issues, such as software bugs and problems related to data quality to ensure continuous monitoring of the organization’s onshore fleet performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in the development of data science products to support understanding and improvement of wind, solar, and battery storage facility performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> writing production-grade Python and SQL code with automated tests<\u002Fli>\n  <li> designing and improving data infrastructures and standards for automation, optimization, and scalability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> communicating with data scientists, performance analysts, and fleet engineers by satisfying pipelines requests, identifying performance issues, and supporting initiatives across teams within onshore.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have one to three years of experience in data engineering using time series data within the energy, science, academic, or related fields<\u002Fli>\n  <li> demonstrate expertise in data collection, aggregation, analysis, visualization, and productionization of data science products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have substantial experience with RDBMS and SQL or similar and are fluent in Python for data science<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in monitoring and orchestrating data pipelines in Databricks or similar and cloud platforms (Azure preferred) with Spark\u002FPySpark being a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with Linux and Linux-based applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or related technical field.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 2023-01-30. <p>Imagine a future where you’re part of the Financial Controlling team, ensuring excellent financial reporting by leveraging business knowledge and experience <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be managing a team responsible for a broad set of financial accounting and reporting processes concerning the Group’s legal entities, incl. month-end closing, reconciliations, statutory accounts, as well as for performing internal controls. You’ll also play a large role in process optimization, aided by your significant experience in the field.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Financial Accounting &amp; Controlling (FAC)<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Financial Controlling team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for delivering standardized, high-quality, and timely reporting products. The FAC team is united in supporting each other’s development and delivering on outcomes with integrity and by valuing teamwork. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>leading technical accounting research and policy-setting, incl. implementing and monitoring compliance with relevant accounting standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> being responsible for the financial controlling and reporting of our North American corporate and joint venture entities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> overseeing the periodic US GAAP reporting for internal and external users and interfacing with external auditors of US GAAP financial statements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> monitoring and managing our US intercompany reconciliations and cost allocation models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> driving the continuous optimization of processes – specifically in connection with month-end closing and our reporting systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> holding responsibility for communication with joint venture partners regarding accounting matters.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a CPA license, or equivalent professional qualification and experience working in a public accounting firm or an accounting department in an international company<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have thorough knowledge of US GAAP, with IFRS experience being a bonus, both from a theoretical and practical point of view<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience with implementing new accounting pronouncements, e.g., revenue recognition, business combinations, and leases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> take a methodical approach to your work and excel at communicating financial accounting concepts in a readily understandable manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can balance multiple priorities and drive timely outcomes in a fast-changing environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have led dynamic teams and can coach and lead your team members through effectively sharing your knowledge and experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where your organization, analytics, linguistic, and mathematical skills are used to increase quality supporting green energy operations and development <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll interpret and administer land contract information, obligations, and payments for various project activities in the development, construction and operations of the renewable energy industry. You’ll have the opportunity to engage with landowners, engineers, land agents, business managers, accountants, attorneys, and other key stakeholders across the full process involved to pursue, construct, and operate a renewable energy project.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Asset Management<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of Land Contract Administration where you, together with your colleagues, will process incoming agreements, maintain ownership records, capture data, and track project status to ensure all obligations of the agreement are being upheld and all payments are being administered correctly. You’ll interface with Development, Construction, Asset Management, Legal, Accounting, GIS, and other teams to administrate and maintain the land contract information using the land contract database to ensure accurately and timely landowner payments and tracking of contractual obligations. As a team, we communicate with each other and with key stakeholders in and outside of the company. We embrace lessons learned, share knowledge, and support development.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>performing all tasks related to analysis and administration of Land Agreement obligations and payment requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> documenting, tracking, and updating information related to land agreements and project activities in the Land Contract Database<\u002Fli>\n  <li> calculating payments according to agreement terms, vesting interest, and project activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> providing reports internally to other teams regarding land contract status, key data, obligations, and payments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> answering inquiries regarding land agreement payments and obligations from internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have at least two years of experience in calculating and administering payments for land agreements in the energy industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have at least two years of experience using a Land Contract Database<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have at least two years of experience in identifying and analyzing key information found within the agreement and needing to be applied to the agreement in order to provide reports and fulfil obligations and payment requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a comprehensive understanding of legal descriptions, vesting interest types, and types of legal agreements related to land and what they do<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> are proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook as well as thrive in verbal and written communication, mathematical calculations, and critical thinking.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than 1 January 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Operations team, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> 1 January 2023, 23:59 EST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Austin <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> Full time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Talent Acquisition Operations US <\u002Fp>\n   <p>the Operations team <\u002Fp>\n   <p>talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 7,292 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><br> <br> <b>An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation or beliefs. We’re committed to secure an inclusive work environment characterized by a respect for all people so everyone feels free to openly share their input and ideas.
