You’ll also be involved in contractor selection for the projects by participating in the tender and nomination process. As you’ll have project management-related tasks as well, it’s important that you’re highly detail-oriented and able to maintain an overview.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to EPC &amp; Operations<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Civil Engineering Management where you, together with your colleagues, will develop state-of-the-art and high-quality onshore civil design, manage civil design processes on onshore substations, harbors, and operation facilities, and review civil and mechanical design packages. You’ll also participate in clarification meetings and negotiations and provide day-to-day site support from a civil engineering perspective. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>managing relationships with internal global stakeholders and defining the onshore scope of work <\u002Fli>\n  <li>managing the civil engineering and design of our onshore substations, harbors, operation facilities, and other onshore\u002Fnear-shore facilities <\u002Fli>\n  <li>performing construction coordination on site <\u002Fli>\n  <li>managing relationships with EPC contractors and JV partners <\u002Fli>\n  <li>assisting in the review of EPC tenders, definition of award criteria, and selection of suppliers. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have 10-15+ years of experience in civil design or civil project management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience managing design consultants or principal contractors within the civil industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> take joy in being part of a fast-paced and diverse international environment bringing together various employee groups, nationalities, cultures, and authorities through in-person and virtual environments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are commercially astute with managerial\u002Ftechnical competences, enabling you to ensure compliance with contract technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have some ‘user level’ experience working with BIM models to make clash identifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in an international environment with the ability to convey complex issues to internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a world leader in green energy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Ørsted is a global leader in offshore wind energy and ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company. To be a frontrunner, we invest significantly in employee development, and from the moment you join us, we’ll support your personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll get the opportunities that will unleash your full potential, and you’ll experience a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic work environment. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Send your application to us no later than February 2, 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, , on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com if you’d like to know more about the position.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that you’re expected to do some travelling in relation to your work.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> February 2, 2023, 23:59 EST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Providence, Annapolis, Atlantic City <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> full-time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Talent Acquisition Operations US <\u002Fp>\n   <p>the Operations team <\u002Fp>\n   <p>talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> 6,000 employees worldwide.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Headquartered in Denmark and located in 13 countries.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ørsted develops, constructs and operates offshore and onshore wind farms, solar farms, energy storage facilities, and bioenergy plants, and provides energy products to its customers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation or beliefs. <p>Imagine a future where you work in a highly skilled team designing and ensuring the electrical interconnection of some of the largest offshore wind farms<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for conceptualizing the electrical systems of wind farms and leading the interconnection process from application through commissioning.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Americas Offshore Engineering<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of the Electrical System Design &amp; Grid Integration function where you, together with your colleagues, will collaborate with our international team consisting of highly skilled professionals responsible for the design and interconnection of our offshore wind projects. As a team, we embrace a culture of open and honest communication. We aspire to consistently develop and improve through feedback and collaborative knowledge sharing, with an innovative and a commercial mindset.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>coordinating between external and internal stakeholders, incl. transmission operators, system operators, and project teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ensuring the electrical design is compliant with US interconnection codes and standards along with transferring technical requirements back to the design teams in Europe<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing the interconnection study process from initial application through the large generator interconnect agreement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> following industry developments regarding offshore interconnections, incl. participation in system operator planning committees<\u002Fli>\n  <li> supporting projects and business development opportunities in the US<\u002Fli>\n  <li> reviewing the PSS\u002FE and PSCAD studies, preparing electrical system design reports and grid code compliance testing and verification.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s, or preferably a master’s degree, in electrical engineering and 5+ years of experience in interconnecting utility scale energy facilities in the Northeast US<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a solid understanding of electrical system modelling and simulation tools e.g., PSS\u002FE, PSCAD, Power Factory, or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understand electrical design considerations of wind farms along with familiarity with wind turbines and their control systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> be acquainted with electrical grid code requirements and interconnection processes for large generator assets in the NYISO region<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in an international environment with the ability to convey complex issues to stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than February 15, 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Operations Team, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> February 15, 2023, 23:59 EST <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Boston, Providence <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Hybrid (office and home-working) <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> full time <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p>Talent Acquisition Operations US <\u002Fp>\n   <p>the Operations team <\u002Fp>\n   <p>talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>About Ørsted<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We develop, construct, and operate offshore and onshore wind farms, solar energy farms, storage facilities, and bioenergy plants in Europe, Asia, and North America.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’ve been ranked the world’s most sustainable energy company for the past four years.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re headquartered in Denmark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We have over 8.000 employees, working in 15 countries and growing.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><br> <br> <b>An equal opportunity employer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ørsted wants all employees to have the same opportunities for impact and growth, regardless of age, nationality, disability, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation or beliefs. We’re committed to secure an inclusive work environment characterized by a respect for all people so everyone feels free to openly share their input and ideas. We also welcome applications from veteran candidates who have engaged in military service of a similar level of experience and responsibility.<\u002Fp> \n  <p><b>Why join?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Imagine a future where you take on the exciting challenge of accelerating the responsible deployment of offshore wind in the Americas region<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll support a team focused on working with policymakers and regulators to accelerate the deployment of responsibly sited offshore wind. You’ll also serve as a leader in developing and advancing solutions to oceans-related regulatory issues and raising the visibility of our organization in conversations at the federal level.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to Government Affairs and Market Strategy<\u002Fb><br> You’ll be part of a dynamic Regulatory Affairs team where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for helping set and shape the organization’s regulatory and legislative agenda to advance the deployment of offshore wind in North America while ensuring species and habitat protection. You’ll manage the team’s agency engagement related to ocean conservation issues, which include development of feasible marine mammal, benthic habitat, endangered species protection measures, marine spatial planning, and scientific research. As a team, we collaborate, embrace complexity, and are invested in ensuring a world that runs on green energy.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>collaborating with our permitting, marine affairs, and biodiversity teams on emerging regulatory issues related to oceans<\u002Fli>\n  <li> managing our responses (written, testimony, comments, etc.) to regulatory proceedings at NOAA Fisheries on issues with potential value implications for our current and future asset portfolio<\u002Fli>\n  <li> preparing briefing materials and correspondence with agency leadership and staff<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participating in industry working groups and trade association meetings related to agency advocacy, as well as representing us at conferences, roundtables, and events<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing our organization as a thought leader on oceans policy and protected species issues, including coordination with the Public Affairs and Brand teams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have a bachelor’s (or higher) degree in a related discipline and at least seven years working experience in government or non-government organizations, or offshore industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have significant experience working directly with relevant federal regulatory agencies, particularly NOAA Fisheries<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a substantive background in regulatory affairs, focusing on issues concerning endangered species and\u002For marine mammals, and administrative procedure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have expertise in developing and advancing policy solutions and communicating complicated issues simply and succinctly<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have the ability to work independently and with a wide range of stakeholder interests, and possess excellent written and oral communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a professional track record as a team player and of adding value through collaborative work with colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Shape the future with us<\u002Fb><br> Send your application to us no later than February 3, 2023. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Please don’t hesitate to contact Talent Acquisition Operations US, Talent Acquisition Operations US, on talentacquisitionUS@orsted.com, if you’d like to know more about the position. KPI's with an emphasis on cost saving, response times and local content<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implement and monitor energy performance measures and digitalisation of FM<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage all Framework orders for FM work including budget and purchase control.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Previous facilities management\u002Fcoordination role<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication, stakeholder management, relationship building, contractor management &amp; project management skills, with the ability to work for a global FM team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced knowledge of HSE, statutory compliance and permit to work systems, and good technical understanding of building fabric, M&amp;E systems and PPM processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualification in building or FM, HSE or related discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to lead FM related business across multiple sites, and an understanding of sustainability and energy optimisation in FM<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n<\u002Fdiv>\n<p><\u002Fp> \n<br>\n<div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <h5 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About the job<\u002Fb><\u002Fh5> \n   <p><b>Application deadline:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><br> , <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Country:<\u002Fb> United States <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Location:<\u002Fb> Port Jefferson <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Workplace:<\u002Fb> Office-based <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Working hours:<\u002Fb> 40 <\u002Fp>\n   <p><b>Employment type:<\u002Fb> Permanent <\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contact person<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Join a global leader in renewable energy<\u002Fb><br> Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. <p>Imagine a future where you’re overseeing project teams and schedules to identify and mature wind, solar, and storage development assets<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us in this role where you’ll play a leading part in the development of wind, solar, and storage projects and manage a cross-functional team to achieve project success.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Welcome to the Ørsted Onshore Project Development team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> You’ll be part of Project Development where you, together with your colleagues, will identify and mature wind, solar, and storage projects in the eastern U.S. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>You’ll play an important role in: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>identifying development prospects, incl. market assessments, initial site reconnaissance, and fatal flaw identification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> establishing and managing relationships with stakeholders, incl. elected officials, regulators, utilities, RTOs, and community leaders, to support project development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> creating, managing, controlling, and evaluating development projects, schedules, and budgets from site identification to COD<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinating with internal resources, such as the Legal, Engineering, Construction, Finance, and Energy Assessment teams, to drive projects forward<\u002Fli>\n  <li> conducting development review of project contracts, incl. real estate, tax abatement, EPC\u002FBOP, PPA, GIA, and other binding agreements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> To succeed in the role, you: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>have strong communication skills and the ability to influence<\u002Fli>\n  <li> hold a BA or BSc degree from an accredited college program<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess 5+ years’ progressively responsible project management experience, preferably in the power industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have strong computer skills incl.
